Package vertx

Class FileStorageVerticle

java.lang.Object
io.vertx.core.AbstractVerticle
vertx.FileStorageVerticle
All Implemented Interfaces:
io.vertx.core.Verticle
public class FileStorageVerticle extends io.vertx.core.AbstractVerticle
Verticle responsible for receiving validated data via the EventBus and persisting it to a local text file.

It listens on the "validated.data" channel and stores incoming JsonObject messages both in memory and by appending them to a text file. Each message is expected to be a properly formatted and validated data record.

This verticle demonstrates non-blocking file writing using executeBlocking() to prevent event loop blocking during I/O operations.

The file is named data.txt and will be created or appended to in the working directory of the application.

Note: This class assumes that messages on "validated.data" are safe and do not require further schema validation at this stage.

Author:
Daniel San Mart√≠n

    • start

      public void start()
      Registers an EventBus consumer on the "validated.data" channel. When a message is received, it is stored in memory and appended to a file.
      Overrides:
      start in class io.vertx.core.AbstractVerticle

    • appendToFile

      private void appendToFile(String content)
      Appends a JSON string to the output file asynchronously. Uses executeBlocking() to ensure the file write does not block the event loop.
      Parameters:
      content - the string to write to file (with newline appended)
